connector.description: Expose WebSocket endpoints and connect to remote WebSocket servers using Vert.x

camel.source.path.host.name: camel.source.path.host
camel.source.path.host.description: The host that the consumer should bind to or the host of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.source.path.port.name: camel.source.path.port
camel.source.path.port.description: The port that the consumer should bind to or port of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.source.path.path.name: camel.source.path.path
camel.source.path.path.description: The path that the consumer should bind to or path of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.source.endpoint.allowedOriginPatte.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowedOriginPattern
camel.source.endpoint.allowedOriginPatte.description: Regex pattern to match the origin header sent by WebSocket clients

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.router.name: camel.source.endpoint.router
camel.source.endpoint.router.description: To use an existing vertx router for the HTTP server

camel.source.endpoint.serverOptions.name: camel.source.endpoint.serverOptions
camel.source.endpoint.serverOptions.description: Sets customized options for configuring the HTTP server hosting the WebSocket for the consumer

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.vertx-websocket.bridgeEr.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.vertx-websocket.bridgeEr.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.vertx-websocket.autowire.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.vertx-websocket.autowire.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.vertx-websocket.router.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.router
camel.component.vertx-websocket.router.description: To provide a custom vertx router to use on the WebSocket server

camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx
camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx.description: To use an existing vertx instead of creating a new instance

camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOpt.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOptions
camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOpt.description: To provide a custom set of vertx options for configuring vertx

camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGloba.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGloba.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
